## CHANGE TYPE(S)

_Check âœ… one. Only in rare cases should you need to check *more* than one:_

- [ ] âœ¨ `feat`: A new feature
- [ ] ğŸ› `fix`: A bug fix
- [ ] ğŸ“– `docs`: Documentation only changes
- [ ] ğŸ’… `style`: Changes that do not affect the meaning of the code
      (white-space, formatting, missing semi-colons, etc)
- [ ] ğŸ“¦ `refactor`: A code change that neither fixes a bug nor adds a feature
- [ ] ğŸš€ `perf`: A code change that improves performance
- [ ] ğŸš¨ `test`: Adding missing tests or correcting existing tests
- [ ] ğŸ‘· `build`: Changes that affect the build system or external dependencies
- [ ] ğŸ’» `ci`: Changes to our CI configuration files and scripts
- [ ] ğŸ› `chore`: Other changes that don't modify src or test files
- [ ] ğŸ”™ `revert`: Reverts a previous commit

_Briefly describe the work included in this PR. Include any useful contextual or
background information, as well as notes to help the reviewer navigate the new
or modified code._

## CHECKLIST

_Be sure all items are_ âœ… _before submitting a PR for review._

- [ ] I ran the test suite - `yarn test` - and fixed any failing tests
